title: Championing Urban Biodiversity for People and the Planet
summary: Sime Darby Property’s strong emphasis on urban biodiversity highlights its dedication to implementing nature-based solutions to enhance flora and fauna. These efforts are crucial for community resilience, safeguarding future communities and ecosystems, and enriching the quality of life for all. As a proponent of urban biodiversity, the Group is committed to preserving, regenerating, and strengthening healthy ecosystems across its townships and developments.

title: Ringgit to remain in tight range versus US dollar
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to remain in range-bound trading against the US dollar this week as markets further digest the global economic outlook, says an analyst.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is likely to remain in range-bound trading against the US dollar this week as markets further digest the global economic outlook, says an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the local currency would likely linger in a narrow range of around 4.7000 after appreciating in the previous week.

He said the market’s focus started to shift to the upcoming Federal Open Market Committee meeting, which i

title: Japan’s services sector to raise investments
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Japanese companies in the services sector in Malaysia are expected to increase investments here.
content:
Jetro

KUALA LUMPUR: Japanese companies in the services sector in Malaysia are expected to increase investments here.

Managing director of Japan External Trade Organisation (Jetro) Kuala Lumpur, Koichi Takano, said Japanese restaurants are making forays here while some legal firms are jointly opening branches with Malaysian partners.

“Malaysia continues to be an attractive destination for Japanese companies, with some planning to expand in the manu

title: FBM KLCI likely to face downward pressure
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to face continued downward pressure this week as investors remain cautious, focusing on defensive sectors and avoiding risky investments.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to face continued downward pressure this week as investors remain cautious, focusing on defensive sectors and avoiding risky investments.

title: Autodesk board replaces CFO after investigation
summary: NEW YORK: Autodesk Inc reassigned its chief financial officer (CFO) after an internal investigation into accounting practices delayed financial filings for weeks.
content:
NEW YORK: Autodesk Inc reassigned its chief financial officer (CFO) after an internal investigation into accounting practices delayed financial filings for weeks.

Deborah Clifford, who has been CFO since March 2021, will become chief strategy officer, effective immediately, the company said last Friday in a statement.

Elizabeth Rafael, an Autodesk board member, was appointed interim CFO and remains on the board.

The decision to replace Clifford as CFO was made by

title: Malaysia’s Islamic finance ecosystem set to attract more investments
summary: KANGAR: The growing Islamic financial ecosystem in Malaysia has the potential to attract more investments, not only from Islamic countries but also from investors who prioritise ethical principles and social responsibility.
content:
KANGAR: The growing Islamic financial ecosystem in Malaysia has the potential to attract more investments, not only from Islamic countries but also from investors who prioritise ethical principles and social responsibility.

Associate Prof Dr Mohd Zukime Mat Junoh, senior lecturer at the Faculty of Business and Communication, Universiti Malaysia Perlis, said that one of the attractions of the Islamic financial system is its adherence to syariah requirements, transparency, and

title: Laurentian bucks bank trend by slashing Toronto office space
summary: TORONTO: Laurentian Bank of Canada is slashing its Toronto office space by two-thirds as it leans into a hybrid work model and seeks cost savings amid a broader strategic revamp.
content:
TORONTO: Laurentian Bank of Canada is slashing its Toronto office space by two-thirds as it leans into a hybrid work model and seeks cost savings amid a broader strategic revamp.

The lender recorded charges of C$13.2mil in the fiscal second quarter “mainly related to the impairment of its premises,” the company said in a statement last Friday.

The reductions wouldn’t affect Laurentian’s Montreal headquarters, corporate offices in Burlington, Ontario, or network of reta

title: Rise in credit card and other unsecured debt in Singapore
summary: SINGAPORE: Credit card billings continued to stay above the S$20bil mark in the first quarter of 2024, although there was a slight fall of about 5% from the high of S$24.3bil in the previous quarter.
content:
SINGAPORE: Credit card billings continued to stay above the S$20bil mark in the first quarter of 2024, although there was a slight fall of about 5% from the high of S$24.3bil in the previous quarter.

The billings first crossed S$20bil in the third quarter of 2022.

The latest amount of S$23.1bil may have been a dip from the previous quarter, but credit card rollover balance and bad debts written off have risen, according to the credit and charge card statistics from the

title: South Korea’s chip exports lead trade gains supporting economy
summary: SEOUL: South Korea’s export growth continued last month, led by demand for semiconductors, supporting optimism among policymakers for a better-than-expected economic expansion this year.
content:
Renewed optimism: Samsung Electronics reports better-than-expected earnings as demand for its memory chips recovers. — Bloomberg

SEOUL: South Korea’s export growth continued last month, led by demand for semiconductors, supporting optimism among policymakers for a better-than-expected economic expansion this year.

title: Gap’s red carpet pivot
is a hit with shoppers
summary: NEW YORK: Wall Street likes what Gap Inc is selling.
content:
On the mend: Gap’s flagship store in Shanghai, China. The company’s recent earnings provide evidence of a textbook retail recovery as sales improved and margins expanded. — Bloomberg

NEW YORK: Wall Street likes what Gap Inc is selling.

The retailer’s shares jumped more than 28% last Friday – the most since November 2023 – following an eye-popping earnings report that showed a fashion overhaul by new chief executive officer Richard Dickso

title: Bankers brace for IPO surge as elections end
summary: New Delhi: India has turned into Asia’s hottest market for share sales including initial public offerings (IPOs), and as elections come to a close, a bumper crop of deals is poised to set a record as investors seek to tap the rapid growth in the region’s third-largest economy.
content:
Growth engine: Steel being forged in a factory in Hooghly, India. Activity in the equity market is expected to rise sharply now that the country’s elections are over. — Reuters

New Delhi: India has turned into Asia’s hottest market for share sales including initial public offerings (IPOs), and as elections come to a close, a bumper crop of deals is poised to set a record as investors seek to tap the rapid growth in the region’s third-largest economy.

title: Household spending going strong
summary: PETALING JAYA: Domestic consumer spending, a key economic driver, is expected to maintain resilience amid higher inflationary pressure and challenges.
content:
OCBC Bank senior Asean economist Lavanya Venkateswaran

PETALING JAYA: Domestic consumer spending, a key economic driver, is expected to maintain resilience amid higher inflationary pressure and challenges.

Economists are projecting household spending to expand by 4% to 5% this year, which is a commendable growth although lower than the pre-Covid-19 pandemic growth rate of 7%.

However, economists and analysts concurred that the consumer spending t

title: Challenges remain in stablising gold market in Vietnam
summary: HANOI: After nine gold auctions, the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) will no longer be using the measure to try and stabilise the market but instead introduce other administrative tools next week, says the central bank’s head.
content:
HANOI: After nine gold auctions, the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) will no longer be using the measure to try and stabilise the market but instead introduce other administrative tools next week, says the central bank’s head.

The goal is to reduce the gap between domestic and global gold prices, as well as to increase transparency in gold-market transactions.

Speaking at the socio-economic discussion session on May 29, Nguyen Thi Hong, the governor of the SBV, said that r

for carbon reduction
summary: Beijing: The carbon reduction action plan released by China’s State Council last Wednesday signals a clear energy-saving roadmap and timeline, experts say.
content:
Workers cleaning solar panels work on the rooftop of the factory of energy equipment manufacture Iraeta on the outskirts of Jinan in eastern China's Shandong province on March 21, 2024. summary: SAN FRANCISCO: Officials from the United States and China gathered last Wednesday in Berkeley, California, putting aside national tensions to focus on a shared challenge: climate change.

title: Over 30% of Vietnamese consumers keen on EVs
summary: HANOI: More than 30% of Vietnamese consumers are interested in purchasing electric vehicles (EVs), according to a recent global automotive consumer study from Deloitte.
content:
VinFast Auto Ltd. electric vehicle VF e34 models at a charging station outside a company's showroom in Hanoi, Vietnam. - Bloomberg

HANOI: More than 30% of Vietnamese consumers are interested in purchasing electric vehicles (EVs), according to a recent global automotive consumer study from Deloitte.

The main drivers for the interest are reduced operating costs, climate-change concerns, and personal health benefits. Driving experience is also an im

title: Vietnam auto industry hits a speed bump - facing a significant downturn in sales
summary: HANOI: The Vietnam car industry is facing a significant downturn in sales and high inventory levels, despite government efforts to provide support through tax and fee reductions, according to auto experts.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A VinFast VF 8 model is seen during a car delivery ceremony at the VinFast car factory in Haiphong province, Vietnam, September 10, 2022. REUTERS/Thinh Nguyen/File Photo

HANOI: The Vietnam car industry is facing a significant downturn in sales and high inventory levels, despite government efforts to provide support through tax and fee reductions, according to auto experts.

title: Fahmi: Telcos ready to ink share subscription agreement with DNB for 5G dual network model
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Telecommunications companies (telcos) involved in the implementation of the dual network 5G model are ready to sign an agreement to take up equity in Digital Nasional Berhad (DNB), said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.He said this development is ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Telecommunications companies (telcos) involved in the implementation of the dual network 5G model are ready to sign an agreement to take up equity in Digital Nasional Berhad (DNB), said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.

He said this development is in line with the timeline to complete the share subscription agreement process for DNB equity acquisition by June 21.

He said the second 5G network also focuses on additional aspects such as usage in the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and industria

summary: Telecommunications companies (telcos) involved in the implementation of the dual network 5G model are ready to sign an agreement to take up equity in Digital Nasional Berhad (DNB), said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.
content:

title: Penang PKR proposes five potential candidates for Sungai Bakap poll
summary:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 2): Penang PKR has suggested the names of five party members for the consideration of president Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim as its candidate for the Sungai Bakap by-election.

Penang PKR state leadership council deputy chairman Datuk Mohamad Abdul Hamid said the names of ...
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 2): Penang PKR has suggested the names of five party members for the consideration of president Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim as its candidate for the Sungai Bakap by-election.

Penang PKR state leadership council deputy chairman Datuk Mohamad Abdul Hamid said the names of potential candidates were submitted by its branches and division in Nibong Tebal.

“The candidates are aged between 30 and 60, some are locals, and there are also candidates from o

title: CISPE denies it is close to deal over antitrust complaint with Microsoft
summary: European trade group CISPE denied a report on Saturday that it was nearing a settlement with Microsoft to withdraw its antitrust complaint with the European Commission about the U.S. company's cloud computing licensing practices.CISPE, whose members include ...
content:
European trade group CISPE denied a report on Saturday that it was nearing a settlement with Microsoft to withdraw its antitrust complaint with the European Commission about the U.S. company's cloud computing licensing practices.

CISPE, whose members include Amazon and 26 small EU cloud providers, filed a complaint with the European Commission in late 2022 alleging that Microsoft's new contractual terms were harming Europe's cloud computing ecosystem.

title: US court approves WeWork bankruptcy exit
summary: NEW YORK: WeWork, the embattled co-working company, has secured final court approval for its restructuring plan, paving the way for it to exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy next month.The US Bankruptcy Court for the District of New Jersey approved WeWork's ...
content:
NEW YORK: WeWork, the embattled co-working company, has secured final court approval for its restructuring plan, paving the way for it to exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy next month.

The US Bankruptcy Court for the District of New Jersey approved WeWork's reorganization plan on Thursday, a crucial milestone for the once high-flying startup that had been weighed down by excessive lease obligations and unsustainable losses.

"We have emerged from this process with a comprehensive restructuring underway and a redoubled focus o

title: China's new home prices inch up for 9th month in May, survey shows
summary: SHANGHAI: New home prices in China rose slightly for a ninth month in May, a private survey showed, driven higher by a slew of supportive steps to prop up the nation's crisis-hit property sector.The average new home price ...
content:
SHANGHAI: New home prices in China rose slightly for a ninth month in May, a private survey showed, driven higher by a slew of supportive steps to prop up the nation's crisis-hit property sector.

The average new home price across 100 cities rose 0.25 per cent on month in May, following a 0.27 per cnet gain in April, the data from real estate researcher China Index Academy showed on Saturday.

China's property sector, a pillar of the economy, has lurched from one crisis to another since 2021 after a regulatory cra

title: Zahid orders swift probe into claims of Israeli container in Johor
summary: Investigation into the alleged presence of a container bearing the logo of the Israel-based shipping company ZIM at a port in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, needs to be expedited, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.
content:
BAGAN DATUK (June 2): Investigation into the alleged presence of a container bearing the logo of the Israel-based shipping company ZIM at a port in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, needs to be expedited, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.

Zahid said that the country is bound to the government's policy of no diplomatic relations and no trade agreements with Israel.

He said if there are Israeli goods in any port in Malaysia using a third party, th

title: Customs Dept duo plead not guilty to graft charges
summary: Two Royal Malaysian Customs Department (Customs) enforcement assistants were charged at the Sessions Court here Sunday with accepting bribes amounting to RM4,300.
content:
KOTA BHARU (June 2): Two Royal Malaysian Customs Department (Customs) enforcement assistants were charged at the Sessions Court here Sunday with accepting bribes amounting to RM4,300.

Mohd Faizul Mat Nasir and Mohamad Rasul Mohd Zukri, both 34, pleaded not guilty after the charges were read separately before judge Ahmad Bazli Bahruddin.

Mohd Faizul was charged with accepting bribes amounting to RM1,750 on July 16, 2020, while Mohamad Rasul was charged with two c

title: IRB’s KL branch office relocated to govt complex on Jalan Tuanku Abdul Halim
summary: The Inland Revenue Board (IRB) Kuala Lumpur branch office is now operating at the government complex on Jalan Tuanku Abdul Halim, Kuala Lumpur.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (June 2): The Inland Revenue Board (IRB) Kuala Lumpur branch office is now operating at the government complex on Jalan Tuanku Abdul Halim, Kuala Lumpur.

The IRB, in a statement, said that the branch’s previous office at Menara Olympia, Kuala Lumpur, has been closed.

It said any correspondence can be forwarded to LHDN Kuala Lumpur, Locked Bag 00010, General Post Office, 50990 Kuala Lumpur.

title: Azrin: Sedania poised for growth in coming months
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sedania Innovator Bhd is cautiously optimistic and dedicated to achieving positive financial outcomes through strategic plans and rigorous risk assessment to increase its brand visibility in key markets. For the cumulative period of 15 months ended March 31, 2024, the group ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sedania Innovator Bhd is cautiously optimistic and dedicated to achieving positive financial outcomes through strategic plans and rigorous risk assessment to increase its brand visibility in key markets. 

For the cumulative period of 15 months ended March 31, 2024, the group posted a net profit of RM2.42 million. Its revenue came in at RM64.14 million. 

The group posted a net loss of RM2.7 million in the quarter ended March 31, 2024, with a revenue of RM14.71 million.

title: UK house prices return to growth after wobble, lender Nationwide says
summary: LONDON: British house prices rose in May after falling in the previous two months as the property market withstood high borrowing costs, figures from mortgage lender Nationwide showed on Friday.Prices increased by 0.4 per cent from April, the data showed....
content:
LONDON: British house prices rose in May after falling in the previous two months as the property market withstood high borrowing costs, figures from mortgage lender Nationwide showed on Friday.

Prices increased by 0.4 per cent from April, the data showed.

Economists polled by Reuters had mostly expected a 0.1 per cent monthly rise.

Compared with May last year, prices were 1.3 per cent higher, a bigger increase than the median forecast in the Reuters poll for a 0.8 per cent gain.

"The market appears to be show

title: Nvidia boss, top chip CEOs to lay out AI plans at Taiwan expo
summary: TAIPEI:  The world's biggest heavyweights in chipmaking and artificial intelligence will converge this week for Taiwan's premier tech expo, with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expected to get a rockstar reception at his keynote speech on Sunday.There is ...
content:
TAIPEI: The world's biggest heavyweights in chipmaking and artificial intelligence will converge this week for Taiwan's premier tech expo, with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expected to get a rockstar reception at his keynote speech on Sunday.

There is outsized interest in the 2024 edition of Computex, thanks to the participation of not just Huang but the leaders of some of Nvidia's main rivals in AI hardware, including AMD, Qualcomm and Intel.

Computex is the top annual tech showcase in Taiwan, whose advanced s

title: China commercial banks' profits squeezed, loan quality holds steady
summary: BEIJING: Chinese commercial banks saw their profitability further squeezed in the first quarter of the year amid a slowing economy, while their non-performing loan ratios remained steady, the country's financial regulator said on Friday.Net interest margin - a ...
content:
BEIJING: Chinese commercial banks saw their profitability further squeezed in the first quarter of the year amid a slowing economy, while their non-performing loan ratios remained steady, the country's financial regulator said on Friday.

Net interest margin - a key gauge of profitability - further narrowed to 1.54 per cent in the quarter from 1.69 per cent in the previous three months, the National Financial Regulatory Administration said in a statement on its website.

Chinese banks face growing profitability pressur

title: Stocks rebound while dollar, Treasury yields fall after US data
summary: NEW YORK/LONDON : MSCI's global equities index staged an afternoon rebound on Friday as investors repositioned for month-end, while the dollar fell with Treasury yields as data showed a modest rise in US inflation in April.After spending most ...
content:
NEW YORK/LONDON : MSCI's global equities index staged an afternoon rebound on Friday as investors repositioned for month-end, while the dollar fell with Treasury yields as data showed a modest rise in US inflation in April.

After spending most of the session in the red, the MSCI All Country World Price Index turned positive ahead of a rebalance of the index.

When Wall Street trading ended, the global index was up 0.57 per cent at 785.54 after falling as low as 776.86 earlier.

"When you get an upside reversal it

title: Struggling Dow transport stocks could be economic warning signal
summary: NEW YORK: It's been a banner year for the major US stock indexes, but one economically sensitive corner of the market sticks out as a sore spot.The Dow Jones Transportation Average has fallen about 5.0 per cent so far ...
content:
NEW YORK: It's been a banner year for the major US stock indexes, but one economically sensitive corner of the market sticks out as a sore spot.

The Dow Jones Transportation Average has fallen about 5.0 per cent so far this year, a significant contrast with the 9.0 per cent year-to-date rise for the benchmark S&P 500 and the 1.0 per cent rise in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which topped 40,000 points for the first time this month.

While major indexes including the S&P 500, the Nasdaq Composite and the Do

title: Microsoft to pay off cloud industry group to end EU antitrust complaint, Politico reports
summary: BENGALURU: Microsoft is close to reaching a multimillion-euro deal with an Amazon-backed cloud lobby to get it to drop an antitrust complaint with the European Commission, Politico reported on Saturday.The deal, which hasn't been accepted yet by members ...
content:
BENGALURU: Microsoft is close to reaching a multimillion-euro deal with an Amazon-backed cloud lobby to get it to drop an antitrust complaint with the European Commission, Politico reported on Saturday.

The deal, which hasn't been accepted yet by members of the lobby group Cloud Infrastructure Services Providers in Europe (CISPE), would see the providers withdraw an investigation request over Microsoft's cloud-licensing agreements, the report said, citing industry officials with knowledge of the proposal.

The pa

title: Egypt's net foreign assets deficit contracts US$586 mln in April
summary: CAIRO: Egypt's net foreign assets (NFAs) deficit contracted by US$586 million in April, central bank data showed on Friday, after the International Monetary Fund paid an US$820 million loan instalment to the country early in the month.The end-April ...
content:
CAIRO: Egypt's net foreign assets (NFAs) deficit contracted by US$586 million in April, central bank data showed on Friday, after the International Monetary Fund paid an US$820 million loan instalment to the country early in the month.

The end-April NFA deficit shrank to 174 billion Egyptian pounds (US$3.68 billion) from 200 billion pounds at end-March, according to the data, the third straight month of decline.

Egypt signed an US$8 billion financial support package with the IMF on March 6 after sharply devaluing its

title: Tesla shareholder sues Musk for alleged US$7.5b insider trading
summary: SAN FRANCISCO:  A Tesla shareholder filed a lawsuit on Thursday accusing chief executive officer Elon Musk of insider trading when he sold over US$7.5 billion (RM35.3 billion) of shares of the electric car maker in late 2022, saying the billionaire entrepreneur ...
content:
SAN FRANCISCO: A Tesla shareholder filed a lawsuit on Thursday accusing chief executive officer Elon Musk of insider trading when he sold over US$7.5 billion (RM35.3 billion) of shares of the electric car maker in late 2022, saying the billionaire entrepreneur sold the shares before potentially disappointing production and delivery numbers were made public.

Shareholder Michael Perry, in the lawsuit filed in Delaware Chancery Court, said that Tesla's share price plummeted after the company's fourth-quarter numbers wer

title: Jakel committed to invest RM1bil this year and more in 2025 to expand
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Jakel family has committed RM1 billion in capital for investment in 2024, with an even larger capital commitment expected in 2025, according to Muhammad Ashraf, director of Jakel Capital Sdn Bhd. He said that digital infrastructure is a key ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Jakel family has committed RM1 billion in capital for investment in 2024, with an even larger capital commitment expected in 2025, according to Muhammad Ashraf, director of Jakel Capital Sdn Bhd. 

He said that digital infrastructure is a key component of the group's diversification strategy.

Jakel Group is partnering with PiDC Holding Bhd to jointly construct a 51 MW data centre in Cyberjaya, Selangor, valued at RM1.2 billion.

title: Ex-Johor mayor charged with allegedly receiving RM1.5m in bribes
summary: The former mayor of the Johor Bahru City Council (MBJB) pleaded not guilty at the Sessions Court here on Sunday, to 12 counts of accepting bribes amounting to RM1.55 million, between 2020 and 2021.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (June 2): The former mayor of the Johor Bahru City Council (MBJB) pleaded not guilty at the Sessions Court here on Sunday, to 12 counts of accepting bribes amounting to RM1.55 million, between 2020 and 2021.

Datuk Adib Azhari Daud, 63, was alleged to have received money for himself as reward for helping two men secure various projects in the MBJB area, through another individual, between RM10,000 and RM250,000, through 12 different transactions.

The

title: Klopp culture
summary: There are only superlatives to describe the legacy Jürgen Klopp leaves behind at Liverpool FC. If you have been following the club’s trajectory, you cannot deny how his charismatic style energised players, fans and the city alike. This week, our contributor K Raman pens a heartfelt auf wiedersehen to the kaiser chief, who has energised players and fans for a long time.
content:

If you have been following the club’s trajectory, you cannot deny how his charismatic style energised players, fans and the city alike. title: A natural homecoming in a bustling city
summary: The June 3 cover story of City & Country features Asia Quest Group’s Kiaramas deDaun in Mont Kiara, Kuala Lumpur, its the sixth development in the Kiaramas Collection and the firm’s first launch in 10 years.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 2): The June 3 cover story of City & Country features Asia Quest Group’s Kiaramas deDaun in Mont Kiara, Kuala Lumpur, its the sixth development in the Kiaramas Collection and the firm’s first launch in 10 years.

This freehold 8.54-acre project is situated along Jalan Desa Kiara, adjacent to Bukit Kiara Hills. It boasts three identical 40-storey residential towers with a total of 661 condominium units, which come in five layouts with built-ups ranging from 1,313 to 4,693 sq ft and
